member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.StreamEncodeType
member.summary: Type of encode a given stream is currently using.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.StreamEncodeType.Uninitialized
member.summary: Stream hasn't initialized an encoder yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.StreamEncodeType.Compressed
member.summary: Stream is passing through compressed bits.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.StreamEncodeType.Software
member.summary: Stream is using a software encoder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.StreamEncodeType.Hardware
member.summary: Stream is using a hardware encoder.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AudioCodec
member.summary: Contains the audio codecs that Expression Encoder supports as output types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AudioCodec.Unknown
member.summary: The audio codec is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AudioCodec.Wma
member.summary: Windows Media Audio codec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AudioCodec.WmaProfessional
member.summary: Windows Media Audio Professional codec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AudioCodec.WmaLossless
member.summary: Windows Media Audio Lossless codec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AudioCodec.WmaVoice
member.summary: Windows Media Audio Voice codec.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AacLevel
member.summary: AAC Audio level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AacLevel.AacLC
member.summary: AAC-LC (Advanced Audio Coding - Low Complexity)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AacLevel.AacHELevel1
member.summary: HE-AAC level 1 (High-Efficiency Advanced Audio Coding level 1)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AacLevel.AacHELevel2
member.summary: HE-AAC level 2 (High-Efficiency Advanced Audio Coding level 2)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.OverlayLayoutMode
member.summary: The type of Overlay layout to do.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.OverlayLayoutMode.WholeSequence
member.summary: The overlay is applied to the entire video.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.OverlayLayoutMode.Custom
member.summary: The overlay is applied during custom times set using the OverlayStartTime and OverlayEndTime properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the source should be deinterlaced, and, if so, how it should be deinterlaced.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.Off
member.summary: Turn off deinterlacing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.AutoBob
member.summary: If the source is interlaced, apply a line-doubling deinterlacing algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.ForceBob
member.summary: Apply a line-doubling deinterlacing algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.AutoPixelAdaptive
member.summary: If the source is interlaced, apply an advanced per-pixel adaptive deinterlacing algorithm if present. Autodetect top or bottom field first.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.ForcePixelAdaptiveTopFieldFirst
member.summary: Apply an advanced per-pixel adaptive deinterlacing algorithm starting with the top field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.ForcePixelAdaptiveBottomFieldFirst
member.summary: Apply an advanced per-pixel adaptive deinterlacing algorithm starting with the bottom field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.InverseTelecine
member.summary: Removes the 3:2 pull-down sequence from the source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.AutoSelectiveBlend
member.summary: If the source is interlaced, apply a selective blending deinterlacing algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.DeinterlaceMode.ForceSelectiveBlend
member.summary: Apply a selective blending deinterlacing algorithm.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ResizeQuality
member.summary: The algorithm to be used when resizing the video.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ResizeQuality.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Lower quality, but fast.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ResizeQuality.Bilinear
member.summary: Average speed and quality.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ResizeQuality.Bicubic
member.summary: Slower, but better quality particularly for larger reductions in size, such as HD to 320 x 240.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ResizeQuality.Super
member.summary: Best quality for down-scaling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ResizeQuality.Lanczos
member.summary: Best quality for up-scaling, such as 320x240 to HD.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoCodec
member.summary: Specifies the type of video codecs that are supported for output encoding of video streams.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoCodec.Unknown
member.summary: The video codec is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoCodec.VC1
member.summary: Specifies that this video profile uses the VC1 codec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoCodec.H264
member.summary: Specifies that this video profile uses the H.264 codec.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.DifferentialQuantization
member.summary: Specifies the DifferentialQuantization options for a VideoProfile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.DifferentialQuantization.Off
member.summary: DifferentialQuantization perceptual optimization will not be used (default).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.DifferentialQuantization.IFrames
member.summary: Only I-frames will be optimized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.DifferentialQuantization.IPFrames
member.summary: I-frames and P-frames will be optimized, but B-frames will not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.DifferentialQuantization.IBPFrames
member.summary: I-frames, P-frames, and B-frames will be optimized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionChromaSearch
member.summary: Specifies the motion chroma search options for a VideoProfile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionChromaSearch.LumaOnly
member.summary: Luma only. The VC-1 encoder searches for motion in luminance values only. Provides fastest performance (encoding speed).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionChromaSearch.LumaWithNearestChroma
member.summary: Luma with nearest integer chroma. Provides a compromise between quality and performance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionChromaSearch.LumaWithTrueChroma
member.summary: Luma with true chroma. Provides the best quality with the lowest performance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionChromaSearch.MacroblockAdaptiveWithNearestChroma
member.summary: Macroblock adaptive with nearest integer chroma. Provides a compromise between quality and performance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionChromaSearch.MacroblockAdaptiveWithTrueChroma
member.summary: Macroblock adaptive with true chroma. Provides a compromise between quality and performance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionMatchMethod
member.summary: Specifies the motion-matching method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionMatchMethod.SAD
member.summary: Provides the best performance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionMatchMethod.MacroblockAdaptiveSADHadamard
member.summary: This option configures the codec to decide which method to use on each macroblock. This can potentially reduce overall computation required for encoding by performing the computationally-intensive Hadamard transform only when appropriate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionMatchMethod.Hadamard
member.summary: Provides the best quality.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionSearchRange
member.summary: Specifies the motion search range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionSearchRange.MacroblockAdaptive
member.summary: The VC-1 encoder selects the most efficient mode. The maximum range never exceeds ±1024.0 H, ±256.0 V.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MacroblockModeCostOption
member.summary: Specifies the cost method used by the codec to determine which macroblock mode to use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MacroblockModeCostOption.DistortionOnly
member.summary: SAD/Hadamard. This option configures the codec to account only for distortion when computing cost.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MacroblockModeCostOption.RateAndDistortion
member.summary: Rate/Distortion cost. This option configures the codec to account for both rate and distortion when computing cost.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VC1OutputMode
member.summary: Specifies the format of the output video stream. Only valid when VideoCodecProfile is set to Advanced.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VC1OutputMode.Raw
member.summary: The encoder generates output for a container format, such as ASF.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VC1OutputMode.ElementaryStream
member.summary: The encoder generates output for an elementary stream with an entry point start code inserted for each GOP. Sequence start codes are inserted as needed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VC1OutputMode.ElementaryStreamSequenceHeader
member.summary: The encoder generates output for an elementary stream with both entry point and sequence start codes inserted for each GOP.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdaptiveDeadZone
member.summary: When large portions of textured areas have coarse details, Adaptive Dead Zone attempts to balance the bit distribution within a picture by discarding more of the information in smooth areas with fine details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdaptiveDeadZone.Off
member.summary: Turn adaptive dead zone off.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdaptiveDeadZone.Conservative
member.summary: Conservatively throw away information in smooth areas with fine details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdaptiveDeadZone.Aggressive
member.summary: Aggressively throw away information in smooth areas with fine details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionVectorCost
member.summary: Used to specify the method used by the codec to estimate the amount of processing required for motion vector coding. The codec uses the cost to determine which features will be used in encoding.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionVectorCost.Static
member.summary: This option uses the same motion vector cost estimate for all macroblocks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MotionVectorCost.Dynamic
member.summary: This option varies the motion vector cost between macroblocks to achieve optimal visual quality.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level
member.summary: H264 Level values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level1
member.summary: Level 1

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level1b
member.summary: Level 1b

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level11
member.summary: Level 1.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level12
member.summary: Level 1.2

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level13
member.summary: Level 1.3

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level2
member.summary: Level 2

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level21
member.summary: Level 2.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level22
member.summary: Level 2.2

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level3
member.summary: Level 3

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level31
member.summary: Level 3.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level32
member.summary: Level 3.2

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level4
member.summary: Level 4

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level41
member.summary: Level 4.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level42
member.summary: Level 4.2

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level5
member.summary: Level 5

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.H264Level.Level51
member.summary: Level 5.1

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity
member.summary: Specify a number for the encoding complexity of the video stream. This value can range from Fastest (0) to Best (5). The higher numbers will produce higher-quality video, but can require substantially more processing time. 0 and 1 are optimized for live encoding where you need to process the frames in real-time, and 2-5 are optimized for offline encoding.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity.Fastest
member.summary: Fastest (0).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity.Fast
member.summary: Fast (1).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity.Good
member.summary: Good (2).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity.Normal
member.summary: Normal (3).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity.Better
member.summary: Better (4).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoComplexity.Best
member.summary: Best (5).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ScriptCommandOutput
member.summary: Specifies where the script commands should be saved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ScriptCommandOutput.Header
member.summary: Place the script commands in the header of the output file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ScriptCommandOutput.Stream
member.summary: Place the script commands in a stream within the output file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.FileType
member.summary: The type of media files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.FileType.None
member.summary: Unknown type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.FileType.Audio
member.summary: A file with an audio stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.FileType.Video
member.summary: A file with a video stream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus
member.summary: The media item status.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.Analyzing
member.summary: The file is being analyzed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.Ready
member.summary: The file has been analyzed and is ready to encode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.WaitingToEncode
member.summary: The job is encoding, but this file has not been started.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.Encoding
member.summary: The file is being encoded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.FinishedEncode
member.summary: The job is encoding and this file has been encoded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.Error
member.summary: The file had an error during analysis or encoding.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ItemStatus.AnalyzingChild
member.summary: Child file is being analyzed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoResizeMode
member.summary: Specifies how the video should be resized to fit the output size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch the video to fill the output frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.VideoResizeMode.Letterbox
member.summary: Stretch the video to fill the output frame while preserving the aspect ratio of the source, letterboxing or pillarboxing as appropriate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ThumbnailMode
member.summary: The type of thumbnail to create.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ThumbnailMode.None
member.summary: Generate no thumbnail.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ThumbnailMode.BestFrame
member.summary: Generate a thumbnail using the first nonsolid color frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ThumbnailMode.FirstFrame
member.summary: Generate a thumbnail using the first frame in the video file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ThumbnailMode.Custom
member.summary: Generate a thumbnail at a custom time that is specified using the ThumbnailTime property.
